intro: Arthrosprion, commonly known as the rock fern, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Araliaceae. It is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves, often adapted to thrive in rocky or arid environments. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Arthrosprion species are found in various regions, particularly in tropical and subtropical areas. Its botanical features make it well-suited for xerophytic conditions, showcasing its resilience in challenging environments.
